alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Livingston; Union (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 12:29PM EST until March 03 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Hardin County in southern Illinois... Northeastern Pope County in southern Illinois... Southern Saline County in southern Illinois... Gallatin County in southern Illinois... Northwestern Crittenden County in western Kentucky... Northern Livingston County in western Kentucky... Southwestern Union County in northwestern Kentucky... * Until 1215 PM CST. * At 1129 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles north of Dixon Springs to near Burna, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Harrisburg, Eldorado, Sturgis, Shawneetown, Rosiclare, Ridgway, Golconda, Equality, Joy, New Haven, Cave-in-Rock, Elizabethtown, Omaha, Old Shawneetown, Junction, Eddyville, Carrsville, Karbers Ridge and Gross. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for southern Illinois...and western and northwestern Kentucky. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CST for southern and southeastern Illinois...and southwestern Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for southern Illinois...and western and northwestern Kentucky. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CST for southern and southeastern Illinois...and southwestern Indiana.
